meanings.definition: Trembling or quivering with fear or cold.
meanings.sent1: The small dog looked shuddering as it faced the thunderstorm.
meanings.sent2: She felt a shuddering chill run down her spine in the icy wind.
meanings.sent3: The haunted house had a shuddering effect on the visitors.
meanings.sent4: His shuddering voice revealed his deep-seated anxiety.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence was broken only by the shuddering sound of footsteps approaching.

meanings.sent1: The sudden shuddering of the ground startled the hikers.
meanings.sent2: She felt a shuddering in her hands after the intense workout.
meanings.sent3: The old car gave a shuddering shake before finally starting.
meanings.sent4: The shuddering of the train made it hard to walk straight.
meanings.sent5: The shuddering of the leaves in the wind created a soothing sound.
